Description: Rim sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian pottery handless miniature chalice or kantharos; interior: glazed (fired reddish in places); palmette with added red and added white petals, and red centre with white outline, and part of lotus in red and white, above white and red bands; exterior: unslipped; black line on edge of rim; on left, two pairs of narrow brown vertical lines with row of black dots between; trace of glaze at lower break, where a diagonal appears on 1924,1201.236, from the same vase.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.236.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1517) (phase 2)
